title: Why is Doran's Shield still unaddressed?
body:
Just how many threads do I have to make for Riot to realize that Dorans Shield desperately needs to be looked at? How many times do I have to prove that the Shield + 1 start is mathematically terrible in every way? Even 2 Reju Beads + 4 pots is a better start on most top lane champs as 1.2hp per sec FLAT regen is terrible all around.

And the best part about this? SHIELD DOESNT EVEN BLOCK 8 DAMAGE! It blocks damage before resistances is applied rather than after! So in reality, you're blocking 5 damage or below and the fact that the value even lowers the longer the game does on. 

It's practically the only item in the game that loses value over time. This is nothing but a glorified noob trap item that a lot of people still buy.

Common misconception about armor is that armor pen counters it. % armor pen counters armor, but because armor is more effective at lower amounts its a direct counter to armor penetration.

Say riven hits you for 300 damage in a combo. With 100 armor this would reduce it to 150 damage. If she had armor penetration of 20. Instead she'd hit you for 168 damage. An increase of only 18 points of damage or a 12% increase in damage .

However, if you had only 20 armor. Her 300 damage combo hits you for 249 damage. But with armor penetration, it goes up to 300 damage... a 51 damage or 17% increase.

Armor penetration is expensive both in runes and on gear. Armor by contrast isn't, 9 armor in seals and a cloth armor completely  negates an armor pen runepage. As a second reason its a hard counter.

Fun fact: rejuvenation beads beat Doran's shield in gold efficiency past 8 + 1/3 base HP Regen. With 3 rejuvenation beads, you need 4 HP Regen to beat the 6 flat HP Regen without considering the 80 health.

This is when calculating gold efficiency by flat HP regen, not % HP regen, which has its own numbers for the sake of calculating its upgrades.

It's great on Gnar and Soraka if you don't need support items, but it kinda sucks on the 1/3 champs with above 8.33 HP regen. It beats Doran's blade in terms of HP Regen (from lifesteal), and it goes great with champs like Katarina who don't have mana or auto attacks. However, it lacks the offensive stats, so it depends on your playstyle and how efficiently you use these stats.

As I stated in one my comments, yes, Shield was objectionably OP at the time. If you want to know how OP it was in terms of value.

------------------
+100 hp
+10 armor
8hp per 5
blocks 6 dmg from autos

Using today's gold value: 200 from armor, 267 from health, and 288 gold from health regen.

Back then, Shield had a value of 755 gold. Thats not including it's passive either.

Current Shield's value? 429 gold. That is a 44% decrease in power.

However I dont know why everybody says buffing shield would make it the primary item for everybody again when that does not have to be the case.

Hell, I would be fine with if Shield just actually blocks 8 damage as advertised and maybe have 10hp per 5. Not too strong especially since you would only have 1 pot.
